method.name: Symbolic Regression for fuzzy-Valued Data, Grammar-based GAP Algorithm

reference.ref: L. Sánchez, I. Couso. Fuzzy random variables-based modeling with GA-P Algorithms. In R. Yager, B. Bouchon-Menier, L. Zadeh (Eds) Information, Uncertainty and Fusion, Kluwer Editors (2000) 245 - 256.

generalDescription.objective: To obtain fuzzy symbolic regression model by means of learning fuzzy rule throught GA-P algorithms.
generalDescription.howWork:
A GA-P algorithm is used to learn a fuzzy symbolic regression model. For each hypothesis, the number of labels and number of rules must be given. In same way, as it is possible to manage any combination of conjuntion and/or disjuntions in the antecedent part of a fuzzy rule, a maximum deep tree size must be given too.
Those parameters are, in conjuntion with GA-P typical parameters, of capital importance in the evolution of this method.

parameterSpec.param: popsize: the number of individuals in the population, GA-P parameter.
numisland: the number of islands or subpopulations, GAP parameter.
steady: indicates how population evolves. A value of 1 forces a steady, while a value of 0 indicates that new individuals substitute old ones. GA-P parameter.
numitera: number of iterations to reach the objectives, GA-P parameter.
toursize: number of individuals selected to tournament selection procedure. GAP parameter.
probmuta: indicates the probability that a mutation operation takes place, GA-P parameter.
amplmuta: the maximum bias that a mutation operation can introduce. GA-P Parameter.
probmigra: probability that an individual of an island is used in a tournament of another island, GA-P parameter.
proboptimlocal: indicates the probability to improve GA-P with local search GA-P parameter.
numoptimlocal: the number of local search steps, GA-P parameter.
idoptimlocal: the local search method used, GA-P parameter.
nichingap: value 1 if niches are going to be used, , GA-P parameter.
maxindniche: maximum number of individual per niche, , GA-P parameter.
probintraniche: probability that a genetic operation can take place with individual of different niches, GA-P parameter.
probcrossga: probability of genetic algorithm (parametric) operations to take place, GA-P parameter.
probmutaga: probability of genetic algorithm (structural) operations to take place, GA-P parameter.
lenchaingap: length of GA-P chain, GA-P parameter.
maxtreeheight: maximum deep of a fuzzy tree.

method.example:
Problem type: Regression Method: Regr-Fuzzy-GAP-SymReg Dataset: daily-electric-energy Training set: daily-electric-energy-10-1tra.dat Test set: daily-electric-energy-10-1tst.dat Test Show results: StatChekMO Parameters: default parameters but numitera = 5000, lenchaingap = 8, maxtreeheight = 6
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the experiment/results/StatCheckCL/TSTRegr-Fuzzy-GAP-SymReg/ folder the regression results for the test set:
TEST RESULTS ============ Model = MSE of all folds: Fold 0 : 0.9606904372629808 Fold 1 : 1.0768630794166585 Fold 2 : 1.3805335268248888 Fold 3 : 0.7918252787217536 Fold 4 : 1.0474616777695849 Fold 5 : 0.5898424111411247 Fold 6 : 1.0027634124587552 Fold 7 : 0.7285141860438138 Fold 8 : 0.8227799738399315 Fold 9 : 0.8056530890642558 Global MSE: 0.9206927072543747 Global stdev: 0.21120390364199967 TRAIN RESULTS ============ Model = MSE of all folds: Fold 0 : 0.9136203494333135 Fold 1 : 0.9009084493800233 Fold 2 : 0.8676800721560227 Fold 3 : 0.9320979959606209 Fold 4 : 0.9041256240283352 Fold 5 : 0.9564315626873201 Fold 6 : 0.9087308062318704 Fold 7 : 0.9396674567725803 Fold 8 : 0.9287108560692703 Fold 9 : 0.9309658122245432 Global MSE: 0.9182938984943899 Global stdev: 0.023556319717720334
We can see too the output and target classes for each case of the test set (result0s0.tra) in experiment/results/Regr-Fuzzy-GAP-SymReg/daily-electric-energy/:
@relation daily_average_cost_of_tkwhe_electry_energy_in_spain_in_2003 @attribute hidraul real[27881.8,206035.0] @attribute nucleal real[114760.0,187105.0] @attribute carbon real[33537.0,234833.0] @attribute fuel real[0.0,67986.5] @attribute gas real[0.0,84452.2] @attribute regesp real[5307.0,16357.0] @attribute precio real[0.765853,5.11875] @inputs hidraul,nucleal,carbon,fuel,gas,regesp @outputs precio @data 2.31615 2.9396262864660234 2.37613 2.9396262864660234 2.25221 2.9396262864660234 2.1057 2.8022163921244396 4.05117 2.9396262864660234 2.50409 2.9396262864660234 4.4184 2.9396262864660234 3.07069 2.9396262864660234 1.8168 2.8022163921244396 1.1095 2.9396262864660234 1.42735 2.9396262864660234 3.34136 2.9396262864660234 2.34377 2.9396262864660234 ...
And the test results (result0s0.tst) in folder experiment/results/Regr-Fuzzy-GAP-SymReg/daily-electric-energy/:
@relation daily_average_cost_of_tkwhe_electry_energy_in_spain_in_2003 @attribute hidraul real[27881.8,206035.0] @attribute nucleal real[114760.0,187105.0] @attribute carbon real[33537.0,234833.0] @attribute fuel real[0.0,67986.5] @attribute gas real[0.0,84452.2] @attribute regesp real[5307.0,16357.0] @attribute precio real[0.765853,5.11875] @inputs hidraul,nucleal,carbon,fuel,gas,regesp @outputs precio @data 2.21261 2.9396262864660234 3.82169 2.9396262864660234 1.3288 2.9396262864660234 2.53167 2.9396262864660234 4.00095 2.9396262864660234 2.9788 2.9396262864660234 1.67147 2.9396262864660234 3.3829 2.9396262864660234 3.19877 2.9396262864660234 2.4381 2.9396262864660234 0.960987 2.9396262864660234 4.14661 2.9396262864660234 2.32848 2.9396262864660234 ...
